title: SNAP VII: Celebrating Photography at the Art Institute
hero_caption: <p>Juliana Huxtable; Wardell Milan. Photo by Mark Poucher; DJ Matt Roan.</p>
description:
Celebrate and support photography at the Art Institute of Chicago with open bar and light bites, music spun by Juliana Huxtable and Matt Roan, and photo sets designed by Wardell Milan.

Party.
8:00 p.m.–12:00 a.m.

Drink.
Open bar and light bites

Pose.
Photo sets designed by artist Wardell Milan

Dance.
Music spun by artist/performer Juliana Huxtable and DJ Matt Roan

Details.
Individual: $150
Platinum: 10 tickets for $7,500

Please use the Modern Wing entrance.

Net proceeds from the evening will enhance the Snap Fund for acquisition of photographs at the Art Institute of Chicago.

Your contribution helps sustain the excellence and accessibility of photography at the Art Institute of Chicago, which features a photography exhibition program dating back to 1900 and a permanent collection since 1949. More than six photography exhibitions are presented annually, along with related public lectures and events nearly every month. The photography collection houses 22,000 works, all of which are viewable online and in person through our public study room.

For more information, or if you would like to support Snap with a donation, please contact snapbenefit@artic.edu or call (312) 443-3663.

This is a 21+ event. Valid ID is required at the door. Platinum level provides one printable or mobile ticket that admits 10 for Platinum access on the Griffin Court balcony. Guests should arrive with the host or give host’s name to registration upon entry.
